intro: Urostigma procerum, commonly known as the slender bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows from 30 to 60 centimeters tall, with hairy stems and small, yellowish-white flowers. Its seed pods are elongated and contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Urostigma procerum is adapted to drought conditions and is often found in disturbed soils and rocky areas.
